attributes.action: Recognise gender purely through a statutory declaration (trans self-ID)
attributes.additional_details: The Analysis of Consultation of The Gender Recognition Act released BY THE BRITISH GOVERNMENT showed that the overwhelming majority of British people support trans self-ID and a de-medicalised process for obtaining a GRC. Likewise, the people support the legal recognition of non-binary and intersex people. The people have spoken, and failure to pass these into law is undemocratic.
attributes.background:
Remove the requirement for a diagnosis of ‘dysphoria’, spousal consent, medical proof, and requirement to live as one’s ‘acquired gender’ for 2 years
Legally recognise non-binary, intersex, and gender non-conforming people by creating a category ‘X’ on birth certificates, passports etc.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign these petitions calling for a similar action: 

Allow trans people over 16 to self-identify:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/579904

Make non-binary a legally recognised gender identity in the UK:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/580220
